"""

How could you have **interpreted** differently?
I could let go of the focus on doing it right or perfectly right away.

Did you notice anything about how you responded emotionally or physically, or through your actions?

So usually, I like, when I feel frustrated, I kinda dwell on those emotions a lot. But today, I just decided to call my grandma and dad immediately, and I think that definitely helped, because, yeah, the emotional frustration that I was feeling, were kind of relieved after just catching up with them and checking in with them. Yeah. I guess sometimes these emotions do, like, deter me from seeing, like, the bigger scope of things, and seeing the bigger picture. So, yeah. I think that was helpful.

"""

Based on the above content, help me answer the following question. Show your answer only, with no explanations, written in a single paragraph, and provide only one answer.
"""

How could you have **reacted** differently?

Whenever I feel negative emotions after a call with my grandpa, I tend to spend time doom-scrolling or just sitting in the same place, consuming mindless media to somehow dilute my emotions. I could have gotten up my chair for a change of scenes.

Did you notice anything about how you responded emotionally or physically, or through your actions?

I think emotionally, physically, emotionally, there wasn't much there, I think, today. But physically, I did feel myself getting a little bit carsick. But I guess I did, like, cost benefit analysis in my head, and I thought that was okay. But during my class, I then felt kind of sleepy. And then I realized, wow, I really could have been sleeping on the bus instead of scrolling for an hour.

"""

Based on the above content, help me answer the following question. Show your answer only, with no explanations, written in a single paragraph, and provide only one answer.
"""

How could you have **reacted** differently?
I could have considered the opportunity cost of scrolling. If I had spent that time resting, I would feel more awake and alert during class.

Did you do anything to impact how the situation unfolded, if any?

I'm pretty close with this friend, so I feel like in a lot of those instances, I feel like I don't need to be as engaged all the time just because we're pretty comfortable with each other as I would, like, someone new that I hadn't met before. So I just, throughout the day, tried to take note of when I thought I was being engaged or, like, I noticed more often if I, like, went to look at my phone or was distracted that I wasn't engaged in the moment.

"""

"""

It's in a hotel. So I have been flying with my daughter from China to back to Boston. And, they are really long flights, so we're both very tired. And, during the layover in Dubai Airport, we were put up in this hotel so we could rest. And my my daughter has been an angel throughout the journey. But physically and just, you know, on every level, I'm very tired. And when we were in a hotel, she asked me, mom, what are you watching? Like, what what am I watching on my phone? And I think that's a very innocent question. But I replied, do I have to report what I'm watching to you? I think that that was not very kind to say.

"""

"""

it was a good thing so its not necessary i think

I'd say that, just for the past, like, few days that I've been responding kind of like not in the best way possible. But, like, obviously, if I don't do anything, then nothing happens. It doesn't make sense that my mind is thinking in that particular way. So, I guess one thing like, so then I've just been reacting in kinda like an apothec sense. Like, oh, it doesn't matter that I'm doing this. And because of that, I think it's going to if I don't, like, change it, then it's going to hinder the, results that I will come to have. So that's something that, I realized and something that I need to, like, change for sure. And then physically, I don't know if I really responded physically other than, like, other than, like, just, being, like, being able to sit down and, like, chin or sit down and just, like, not be, like, depressed, but just, like, I guess, like, to, like, be honest, like, the feelings of just, like, sadness, not depression, I wouldn't say, but, like, just, like, feelings of embarrassment or just, like, thoughts of, that, like, I'm not, like, good enough. It just, like, continues to creep back in my head. And because of that, I'm responding by potentially, like just, like, not really doing, anything to, change the situation or anything to, better myself. And that's something that, I'm trying to or something that I have changed a bit. Like, it's been better. Like, if I get, like, rejected, then I don't have the mindset of just, like, doing nothing. But, what I need to start doing is instead of just, like and I get rejected, do the same thing over and again, but just do something that's completely different. Like, make the effort to get a referral or go into MIT, like, and talk to people. Network. Go to networking events. Go to job fairs as opposed to just going on job boards and then hoping that somebody responds. Because it has happened, but it's only happened, like, once or twice for me. So, I just need to, like, slow down and then reassess my strategy. That's something that's something that I noticed that I haven't been doing and something that I can definitely change from now on because now I'm thinking about it and I'm realizing it because I'm thinking out loud. So, yeah.

"""

Based on the above content, help me answer the following question. Show your answer only, with no explanations, written in a single paragraph, and provide only one answer.
"""

How could you have **reacted** differently?

I need to react in a way that every single failure makes me not only mentally strong, but also moves me to do an action that opposes the dormant state that I take sometimes. For example, if I don't want to apply for any job for the remainder of the day because of one rejection, I should apply to 10 more jobs.

Did you notice anything about how you responded emotionally or physically, or through your actions?

I guess emotionally or physically. Yeah. Anytime I think about, like, about, like, applying applying for the jobs, I just like, emotionally, like, it it varies. Like, if it's, like, towards the end of the week, like, let's say, Thursday, Friday, I'm kinda just like, oh, man. There's, little little, people reaching out. It's rough. It's hard. Like, I don't know. I just put myself into a a mind where I'm just, like, self doubting. Like, will I actually get a job? But, like, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, I'm more excited because, like, usually, I have interviews that are planned throughout the week. And, also, it's the beginning of the week. Like, it's kinda like a new start in that kinda sense. So, Yeah. I guess, like, when the situation of, like, or I guess, like, even, like, with my financial situation, like, I'm excited because, like, I'm able to be able to do good work for a company and also be able to earn income at the same time. Like, that's that's great. And then, like, my recent most recent check did come in. It was good. It was, it was very helpful because I'm able to I was able to cover some, expenses from, that I needed to cover. But, emotionally, I mean, it was very encouraging to see that, but it I know that it's something that, will I will I will still need to be I also need to continue to put in a lot more work in order to get to a place where I'm financially stable. Yeah. I think that, through my actions, I don't I don't really necessarily know how I responded that way, but, I mean, I was happy, I get in that with regard. But I guess through my actions, like, I kinda responded by, at least towards the end of the week, just, like, by wasting a bit more time. I think that if I were to respond in a more positive way, like, using the fact that I don't have an ideal job as fuel to, like, continue and apply to research every single thing that I need to. Like, I have so many resources, Chachibuty, Google, friends that are already in good situations, professors. Like, I just I just need to find like, I just need to structure it in a way that makes it fun for myself to just go out and try to find a job. So, maybe making it like a bounty or something like, okay, how many professors did you talk to this week? If you did, then you can treat yourself to something good. Or, how many people how many jobs do you apply to? If you apply to this many jobs, then you can go get some dessert or something. I don't know. I think if I were to, react to failure by making it trying to make it fun, that'd be very good and very positive to, like, the way that I operate.

"""
